title: Inflation rate in Zimbabwe 2024
yAxis: Inflation rate compared to previous year
summary: The chart at hand is a line chart where the x axis denotes Year and a y axis denotes Inflation rate compared to previous year. In total the number of data points it has is 41.
In general Inflation rate compared to previous year has rose over the Year.
The most drastic increase took place within the Year 2018 and 2019.
Maximum Inflation rate compared to previous year, about 161.81 was reported at Year 2019
The lowest Inflation rate compared to previous year, of value 0.21 was reported at Year 2014

max_summary: The chart in general has a zig-zag shape.
The chart in general has a zig-zag shape.
The chart at hand is a line chart where the x axis denotes Year and a y axis denotes Inflation rate compared to previous year. In total the number of data points it has is 41.
In general Inflation rate compared to previous year has rose over the Year.
The chart in general has a zig-zag shape.
The steepest increase occurs in between the Year 2018 and 2019.
Maximum Inflation rate compared to previous year, about 161.81 was reported at Year 2019
The lowest Inflation rate compared to previous year, of value 0.21 was reported at Year 2014

The line drastically increased by 8.6 times from Year 1984 to 1985,remained stable by 12.1 times from Year 1987 to 1988,increased by 3.6 times from Year 1988 to 1989,increased by 9.7 times from Year 1990 to 1991,remained stable by 4.4 times from Year 1991 to 1992,remained stable by 7.9 times from Year 1992 to 1993,increased by 7.3 times from Year 1993 to 1994,increased by 5.5 times from Year 1994 to 1995,remained stable by 6.2 times from Year 1996 to 1997,increased by 28.9 times from Year 1997 to 1998,increased by 8.3 times from Year 2000 to 2001,remained stable by 4.0 times from Year 2002 to 2003,increased by 13.3 times from Year 2003 to 2004,remained stable by 3.6 times from Year 2004 to 2005,remained stable by 2.2 times from Year 2006 to 2007,remained stable by 2.2 times from Year 2007 to 2008,remained stable by 25.2 times from Year 2008 to 2009,remained stable by 7.8 times from Year 2013 to 2014,increased by 11.5 times from Year 2014 to 2015,increased by 11.7 times from Year 2017 to 2018,increased by 15.3 times from Year 2018 to 2019, and lastly, remained stable by 13.4 times from Year 2020 to 2021.
